name: enamour
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to cause someone to like or love something or someone: The tail fins and rocket details of 1950s cars were an impression of the technology that enamoured that decade. Persephone was the Greek goddess who enamoured Hades, the king of the underworld.
More examplesFewer examplesTo have such a prize taken from him in this way cannot have enamoured the player.Some referees were not enamoured by his physical approach.I looked for my own tribe to join and it was the skinhead movement that enamoured me the most.
